headline: Ohio Sen. Rob Portman endorses Jane Timken in Republican primary to replace him
author: Tyler Olson
sentences: "Rob successfully led the effort to pass President Trump’s tax cuts, is the leader in the U.S. Senate in fighting the opioid epidemic, and has consistently delivered results for Ohio on issue after issue."
Timken's campaign also said the Portman endorsement will unlock about $800,000 in pledges from donors who said they would give to the candidate if Portman endorsed her.
She was elected to that post after the 2016 presidential election as part of a wave of pro-Trump officials who came to power in state parties after that race.
Rob Portman Wednesday endorsed Jane Timken in the crowded GOP primary to replace him, the second major endorsement for Timken in as many days.
"Senator Portman is a thoughtful, conservative leader who has served Ohio with distinction, and I’m honored to have his support," Timken said.
Portman's endorsement comes the day after Kellyanne Conway, the longtime counselor to former President Donald Trump, endorsed Timken.
"I believe Jane Timken is the best candidate to advance conservative Republican policies to help Ohio workers and families.
Pat Toomey, R-Pa., Richard Burr, R-N.C., and Roy Blunt, R-Mo., have remained neutral on the contests to fill their seats.

"She has a record of success, including working tirelessly for years to support Republicans at every level."
Portman is the second retiring Republican senator to make an endorsement in the primary to replace him.
